meanings.definition: Belonging to or forming a second canon
meanings.sent1: The professor discussed the deuterocanonical texts in class.
meanings.sent2: The deuterocanonical scriptures were not part of the original collection.
meanings.sent3: The deuterocanonical books decided to have a reunion party.
meanings.sent4: Her deuterocanonical approach to problem-solving impressed her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The deuterocanonical nature of the new law made it controversial.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to certain books of the Old Testament not included in the Hebrew Bible but included in the Septuagint and Vulgate versions
meanings.sent1: The deuterocanonical texts provide additional insights into ancient beliefs.
meanings.sent2: Scholars debated the significance of the deuterocanonical scriptures.
meanings.sent3: The deuterocanonical books threw a surprise party for the Hebrew Bible texts.
meanings.sent4: Her knowledge of the deuterocanonical texts was as deep as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The deuterocanonical stories painted a vivid picture of history.
